results.title: Money movement mindset
results.brief_description: Annoying finance bros beware: the comedians are coming for your grindset! Financial planning is a popular podcast and video genre online — but many of them are hosted by young men whose views on how to make bank can be hilariously macho, and based on an unrealistic picture of how and why most people spend their money. In this video, Tiktok comedian Caroline Baniewicz skewers finance bro culture, satirising the impractical ways that these podcasters advise on making your first million.
results.description: Annoying finance bros beware: the comedians are coming for your grindset! Financial planning is a popular podcast and video genre online — many of them hosted by young men whose views on how to make bank can be hilariously macho and out of touch. In this video, Tiktok comedian Caroline Baniewicz skewers finance bro culture, satirising the impractical ways that these podcasters advise on making your first million.
description_for_label: Annoying finance bros beware: the comedians are coming for your grindset! Financial planning is a popular podcast and video genre online — many of them hosted by young men whose views on how to make bank can be hilariously macho and out of touch. In this video, Tiktok comedian Caroline Baniewicz skewers finance bro culture, satirising the impractical ways that these podcasters advise on making your first million.

results.title: Cyberthon V: Spectrum 7 - Violet
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 7 – Violet was broadcast as the seventh of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Future Films (Jeff Jaffers), Third Eye ‘Ambi Jam’ (Gus Till, Ollie Olsen, Geoffrey Hales, Simon Polinski), Cyberdada (Troy Innocent & Dale Nason), Phuture (Crissie Seivers and M. Buchanan ‘Equinox Comics’), Stelarc, Theatre TV (Eliza, Mari Giambanco and Julie Turner), Space Between the Gaps (Paul Gafney), Corruption & Vice (Ju-Ann Lam), abcTVxyz (Dale Nason and Kim Bounds) and Dont Shoot The Messenger (Steve Middleton)

Cyberthon VII: Spectrum 7 – Violet is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

results.title: Jafar's blue tiles (Iran)
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The restoration of a 600-year-old brick dome in his village is the focal point of fourteen-year-old Jafar’s interests and activities as he is seen making and installing twelve richly colored tiles that adorn the dome. Told from Jafar’s point of view, explains the significance of the project and the brickmaking process in the culture and customs of his country and captures vistas of the Iranian landscape.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films

results.title: Pathways
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, video, projections, text, audio, bespoke screens, tiered  wooden seating , timber and LED strips
results.brief_description:
A collaboration between artist-filmmaker Jeff Doring and the Ngarinyin Aboriginal Corporation. This spatial installation provides access and insight into the art and culture of the Ngarinyin people. The intention is to record and interpret a broad spectrum of Ngarinyin knowledge and law. The work consists of five discrete and interrelated elements:
1. The Introduction zone: a space consisting of a text, audio, visual introduction to the installation.
2. The Water and Wanjina zone: a corridor with apertures that open on the side to reveal visual works.
3. The Man Blood Law zone: a three screen installation with tiered seating that lies at the end of the Water and Wanjina corridor.
4. The Cave zone: an exhibition space which spatially represents a cave with images projected inside it.
5. The Today zone: a space which provides a contemporary perspective on the exhibition via a web installation.

results.title: Tomatoes for processing
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane, Rod Kefford, Ann Millard and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description:
Film begins with instructions on how to garner and prepare tomato seeds for planting, before focusing on the seed germination process and how to cultivate a good crop of seedlings.

The seedlings are then uprooted and planted in larger fields. Manual and semi-automatic seedling planting techniques are shown using different types of machinery.

When fully grown the tomatoes are picked and packed into wooden crates. Film details the correct picking and packing process.

Finally, the tomatoes are taken to a factory, where they are pulped and made into tomato sauce.

results.title: Space flight
results.brief_description: Made by a special “Plasti-Cine” technique, in this film the hero, Dan, passes an amusing set of tests for health fitness, then flies a space rocket to the planet Venus. After battling the demon Nicotine, Dan persuades the Venusians to destroy the groves of cigarette trees to abolish smoking.
